security_audit.summary: Pure markdown skill file containing only documentation and prompt guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. The skill provides a framework for performing code reviews and contains illustrative examples only.

content.user_title: Review code for security, style, and performance issues
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides a systematic framework for comprehensive code reviews covering security vulnerabilities, style violations, performance issues, and best practices with consistent severity levels.
actual_capabilities: Perform security vulnerability checks including injection attacks and authentication flaws
Verify code style consistency with naming conventions and formatting standards
Identify performance issues such as N+1 queries and inefficient algorithms
Check error handling patterns and logging practices
Generate structured review reports with severity levels
Validate test coverage for code changes
limitations: Does not execute code or run automated tests
Cannot access external APIs or dependency vulnerability databases
Limited to text-based review without runtime analysis
Relies on the AI model understanding the codebase context provided

use_cases.title: Pre-commit code review
use_cases.description: Review code changes before committing to catch issues early and maintain code quality standards across the codebase.

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability audit
use_cases.description: Systematically audit code for security issues including SQL injection, XSS, authentication bypass, and hardcoded secrets.

use_cases.title: Code quality enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure team code follows established conventions, performance patterns, and error handling best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Quick file review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-review skill to review the following code for security vulnerabilities, style issues, and performance problems. Report findings by severity level.

prompt_templates.title: Pull request review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-review skill. First, run `git diff` to see the changes. Then review each changed file for security issues, style violations, performance problems, and best practices. Summarize findings by severity.

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-review skill with focus on security. Check for: SQL injection, command injection, XSS, authentication issues, authorization flaws, hardcoded secrets, and insecure dependencies. Report any findings.

prompt_templates.title: Full codebase review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-review skill to perform a comprehensive review of the codebase. Cover security, style, performance, error handling, testing, and documentation. Generate a detailed report with actionable recommendations.

output_examples.input: Review the changes in this pull request for security and quality issues
output: - SQL injection risk in UserService.ts:42 - string concatenation in query
- Inconsistent naming: use camelCase for variables
- Consider adding JSDoc comments to exported functions

best_practices: Run code review before every commit or pull request to catch issues early when they are cheaper to fix
Provide clear context about the codebase and changes to help the review identify relevant issues
Use severity levels to prioritize fixes - focus on critical and high issues first
anti_patterns: Skipping code review for small changes - even small changes can introduce security vulnerabilities
Not providing context about the purpose of changes - understanding intent helps identify logic errors
Ignoring low-severity findings - they often compound into larger problems over time

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: This skill can be used alongside CI tools. Run the skill on diffs, then use autonomous-ci to verify builds pass after fixes.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with any language. Security patterns like injection and XSS apply broadly. Language-specific issues require model context.

faq.question: How is this different from automated security scanners?
faq.answer: Automated scanners find known patterns. This skill provides contextual analysis, logic review, and architectural feedback humans excel at.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. Code reviewed stays within your AI session. Only the AI model processes it according to your provider's privacy terms.

faq.question: Can I customize the review criteria?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill framework is flexible. Focus on specific areas by emphasizing security, performance, or style in your prompt.
